item.description:
The First Beautiful Thing (La Prima Cosa Bella)

In a provincial Italian town in 1971, Anna, a beautiful mother of two young children, struggles to provide for her small family, desperate to find opportunities in a new home. The film catches up with the family after many years have passed. Directed by Paolo Virzi.

"Director Virzi's artful interweaving of past and present narratives is employed far more effectively here than in most family-saga melodramas. He and fellow writers Francesco Bruni and Francesco Piccolo orchestrate the ebb and flow of comic farce, brooding character drama and poignant nostalgia with taste and efficiency." - John Dewitte, Chicago Foreign Film Examiner

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: The First Beautiful Thing (La Prima Cosa Bella) @ Real Art Ways
